hudson.model.StringParameterDefinition.name: MYSQL_HOST_NAME
hudson.model.StringParameterDefinition.description: The server name on which MySQL is running

hudson.model.StringParameterDefinition.name: MYSQL_USER_NAME
hudson.model.StringParameterDefinition.description: The root username for the MySQL Database. The user should privileges to create users in the system.

hudson.model.PasswordParameterDefinition.name: MYSQL_PASSWORD
hudson.model.PasswordParameterDefinition.description: The root user password for the MySQL Database

hudson.model.StringParameterDefinition.name: MYSQL_PORT
hudson.model.StringParameterDefinition.description: MySQL server is listening on, used by MySQL client, MySQL Connectors

hudson.tasks.Shell.command:
#!/usr/bin/env bash echo "Configure Remote MySql Instance"
apt-get -y install mysql-client
FILE="/root/.my.cnf" cat <<EOM >$FILE [mysql] host=$MYSQL_HOST_NAME user=$MYSQL_USER_NAME password="$MYSQL_PASSWORD" port=$MYSQL_PORT EOM echo ""
flyway_auth_url=jdbc:mysql://$MYSQL_HOST_NAME:$MYSQL_PORT/auth?serverTimezone=UTC flyway_picsure_url=jdbc:mysql://$MYSQL_HOST_NAME:$MYSQL_PORT/picsure?serverTimezone=UTC
cd /usr/local/docker-config/flyway/auth sed -i '/flyway.url/d' ./flyway-auth.conf sed -i "1iflyway.url=$flyway_auth_url" ./flyway-auth.conf sed -i '/host/d' ./sql.properties sed -i "1ihost=$MYSQL_HOST_NAME" ./sql.properties sed -i '/port/d' ./sql.properties sed -i "2iport=$MYSQL_PORT" ./sql.properties
cd /usr/local/docker-config/flyway/picsure sed -i '/flyway.url/d' ./flyway-picsure.conf sed -i "1iflyway.url=$flyway_picsure_url" ./flyway-picsure.conf sed -i '/host/d' ./sql.properties sed -i "1ihost=$MYSQL_HOST_NAME" ./sql.properties sed -i '/port/d' ./sql.properties sed -i "2iport=$MYSQL_PORT" ./sql.properties
cd /usr/local/docker-config/wildfly sed -i 's/jdbc:mysql*.*auth/jdbc:mysql:\/\/'$MYSQL_HOST_NAME':'$MYSQL_PORT'\/auth/g' /usr/local/docker-config/wildfly/standalone.xml sed -i 's/jdbc:mysql*.*picsure/jdbc:mysql:\/\/'$MYSQL_HOST_NAME':'$MYSQL_PORT'\/picsure/g' /usr/local/docker-config/wildfly/standalone.xml
echo `grep "password" /usr/local/docker-config/flyway/auth/sql.properties | cut -d "=" -f2-` > airflow.tmp sed -n -e '/<user-name>auth/{n;p}' ./standalone.xml > auth.tmp sed -n -e '/<user-name>picsure/{n;p}' ./standalone.xml > picsure.tmp
AIRFLOW_PASSWORD=`grep "password" /usr/local/docker-config/flyway/auth/sql.properties | cut -d "=" -f2-` PICSURE_PASSWORD=`sed -n 's/<password>\(.*\)<\/password>/\1/p' picsure.tmp` AUTH_PASSWORD=`sed -n 's/<password>\(.*\)<\/password>/\1/p' auth.tmp`
mysql -u root -p$MYSQL_PASSWORD -h $MYSQL_HOST_NAME -P $MYSQL_PORT -e "drop database IF EXISTS auth; create database auth;" mysql -u root -p$MYSQL_PASSWORD -h $MYSQL_HOST_NAME -P $MYSQL_PORT -e "drop database IF EXISTS picsure; create database picsure;"
mysql -u root -p$MYSQL_PASSWORD -h $MYSQL_HOST_NAME -P $MYSQL_PORT -e "grant all privileges on auth.* to 'airflow'@'%' identified by '`cat airflow.tmp`';flush privileges;"; mysql -u root -p$MYSQL_PASSWORD -h $MYSQL_HOST_NAME -P $MYSQL_PORT -e "grant all privileges on picsure.* to 'airflow'@'%' identified by '`cat airflow.tmp`';flush privileges;";
